sn35.104:4.2: “Mendicants, I will teach you an explanation of the teaching, an explanation of one who has reached sanctuary.
sn35.104:4.4: And what is an explanation of the teaching, an explanation of one who has reached sanctuary?
sn35.104:4.5: There are sights cognizable by the eye that are likable, desirable, agreeable, pleasant, sensual, and arousing.
sn35.104:4.6: The Realized One has given these up, cut them off at the root, made them like a palm stump, and exterminated them, so they are unable to arise in the future.
sn35.104:4.7: He teaches meditation for giving them up. That’s why the Realized One is called one who has reached sanctuary. …
sn35.104:4.8: There are phenomena cognizable by the mind that are likable, desirable, agreeable, pleasant, sensual, and arousing.
sn35.104:4.9: The Realized One has given these up, cut them off at the root, made them like a palm stump, and exterminated them, so they are unable to arise in the future.
sn35.104:4.10: He teaches meditation for giving them up. That’s why the Realized One is called one who has reached sanctuary.
sn35.104:4.11: This is an explanation of the teaching, an explanation of one who has reached sanctuary.”
